meanings.definition: The phenomenon in which molecules with the same molecular formula and connectivity of atoms have different spatial arrangements.
meanings.sent1: Stereoisomerism helps us understand how molecules can look different even with the same atoms.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study stereoisomerism to learn about the shapes of molecules.
meanings.sent3: At the chemistry party, stereoisomerism was the talk of the town!
meanings.sent4: The concept of stereoisomerism is like a puzzle where atoms can be arranged in various ways.
meanings.sent5: Visualizing stereoisomerism is like seeing a 3D model of molecules in action.

meanings.definition: The existence of isomers that differ only in the spatial arrangement of their atoms.
meanings.sent1: Understanding stereoisomerism is crucial in distinguishing between different isomers.
meanings.sent2: Chemists use stereoisomerism to identify unique arrangements of atoms in molecules.
meanings.sent3: The competition for the best stereoisomerism joke was fierce among the scientists.
meanings.sent4: In nature, stereoisomerism is like nature's way of creating diversity in molecules.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of stereoisomerism lies in the subtle differences in molecular structures.
